resources.string: Calculator to Estimate the Exposure Window for Ebola Virus Disease
Number of days between symptom onset and death (typically, 7-10):
Use the fields below to change the incubation period for calculations of potential exposure periods. In general,these do not need to be altered, so only edit if needed.
Incubation Period for Ebola Virus Disease
Number of days from start of symptoms to start of bleeding (typically, at least 6 days):
At symptom onset, was the patient bleeding?

This calculator estimates the period of time during which a person with Ebola virus disease may have been exposed to the virus.

 This tool may be useful in guiding case investigations by helping to more reliably calculate the period during which the patient was likely to have been exposed to Ebola virus.

 Important: this only provides an estimate of the exposure window. The true exposure window may be different.

 The information provided by this tool need to be used in the context of other known information about the case in question.
At the onset of symptoms, did the patient have diarrhea?
Number of days from start of symptoms to start of diarrhea (typically, at least 4 days):
